messages.content: ComfyUI_TensorRT is a node that enables the best performance on NVIDIA RTXâ„¢ Graphics Cards (GPUs) for Stable Diffusion by leveraging NVIDIA TensorRT.
Which models are supported by ComfyUI_TensorRT?
ComfyUI_TensorRT supports Stable Diffusion 1.5, 2.1, 3.0, SDXL, SDXL Turbo, Stable Video Diffusion, Stable Video Diffusion-XT, and AuraFlow.
What are the VRAM requirements for running SDXL and SDXL Turbo with ComfyUI_TensorRT?
For SDXL and SDXL Turbo, a GPU with 12 GB or more VRAM is recommended for best performance due to its size and computational intensity.
What are the VRAM requirements for running Stable Video Diffusion (SVD) with ComfyUI_TensorRT?
For Stable Video Diffusion (SVD), a GPU with 16 GB or more VRAM is recommended.
What are the two types of TensorRT engines that can be built using ComfyUI_TensorRT?
You have the option to build either dynamic or static TensorRT engines using ComfyUI_TensorRT.
What are the advantages of using dynamic TensorRT engines in ComfyUI_TensorRT?
Dynamic engines support a range of resolutions and batch sizes, specified by the min and max parameters. Best performance will occur when using the optimal (opt) resolution and batch size.
What are the advantages of using static TensorRT engines in ComfyUI_TensorRT?
Static engines provide the same performance boost as the optimal settings for the dynamic engines, and require less VRAM.
How can you load TensorRT engines in ComfyUI?
TensorRT Engines are loaded using the TensorRT Loader node in ComfyUI.
Are ComfyUI TensorRT engines compatible with ControlNets or LoRAs?
ComfyUI TensorRT engines are not yet compatible with ControlNets or LoRAs. Compatibility will be enabled in a future update.
